models: Airbus A220, Airbus A320, Airbus A321, Boeing 737, Embraer E-175, Airbus A330, Boeing 767, Boeing 777, Boeing 787 Dreamliner
description: Canada’s largest airline, founded in 1937 as Trans-Canada Air Lines. It became Air Canada in 1965 and is the country’s flag carrier with extensive domestic and global routes.

founders: Tim Morgan, Clive Beddoe, Donald Bell, David Neeleman, Mark Hill
description: Established in 1996 as a low-cost alternative to Air Canada, WestJet has grown rapidly into one of Canada’s major airlines with expanding international service.
Founded in 2005 as a regional carrier, Flair transformed into an ultra-low-cost airline focusing on affordable flights across Canada.
Launched in 2006, Porter built its niche on comfortable regional flights out of Toronto’s downtown airport, formerly the site of the old City Centre Airport.

founders: François Legault, Jean-Marc Eustache, Lina De Cesare, Philippe Sureau
description: Founded in 1986, Air Transat specializes in holiday charters and scheduled flights mainly to Europe and the Caribbean, growing from a small tour operator.

founders: Pacific Western Airlines, Canadian Pacific Air Lines
description: Originating from the merger of Air Inuit and Inter-Canadien, Canadian North serves remote northern communities, providing crucial passenger and cargo services.
Established in 2005, Sunwing operates mainly charter and scheduled flights to vacation destinations, evolving from a travel company subsidiary.

models: Airbus A319, Airbus A320, Airbus A321, Boeing 737, Boeing 757, Boeing 767, Boeing 777, Boeing 787 Dreamliner, Embraer E-170, Embraer E-175
description: Founded in 1926 as Varney Air Lines, United grew through mergers into one of the world’s largest airlines with a vast international network. It has the largest fleet size in the world+

models: Airbus A319, Airbus A320, Airbus A321, Boeing 737, Boeing 757, Boeing 767, Boeing 777, Boeing 787 Dreamliner, Embraer E-170, Embraer E-175
founders: Robertson Aircraft Corporation, Colonial Air Transport
description: Established in 1930 from a merger of more than 80 small airlines, American is a founding member of the Oneworld alliance and a global industry leader.

models: Airbus A220, Airbus A319, Airbus A320, Airbus A321, Boeing 717, Boeing 737, Boeing 757, Boeing 767, Boeing 767, Boeing 787 Dreamliner
description: Starting in 1924 as a crop dusting company called Huff Daland Dusters, Delta evolved into a major passenger airline with a strong US and global presence.
Tracing roots to 1932 as McGee Airways, Alaska Airlines grew by acquiring regional carriers and serving the US West Coast and Alaska extensively.

models: Airbus A321, Airbus A330, Boeing 717, Boeing 767, Boeing 787 Dreamliner
description: Founded in 1929 as Inter-Island Airways, it is the oldest US carrier operating under its original name, connecting the Hawaiian Islands and beyond.

founders: Mitch Allee, Jim Patterson, Capt. Dave Beadle
description: Founded in 1997 as a charter operator, Allegiant shifted to an ultra-low-cost scheduled service focusing on underserved markets.

models: Airbus A320, Airbus A321, Embraer E-190
description: Launched in 1999 to provide low-cost service with a focus on passenger comfort and technology, rapidly expanding routes across the US and Caribbean.
Began in 1967 as a regional airline focused on low fares and quick turnarounds; it’s now the largest domestic low-cost carrier in the US.

models: Airbus A319, Airbus A320, Airbus A321
description: Started in 1980 as a regional airline named Charter One, Spirit transformed into an ultra-low-cost carrier focusing on bare-bones, low-fare flights.

models: Airbus A319, Airbus A320, Airbus A321
founders: Frederick W. Rick Brown, Janice Brown, Bob Schulman
description: Founded in 1994 after the original Frontier Airlines (1950-1986) ceased operations, it now operates as a low-cost carrier with a focus on environmental sustainability.
